availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John J. Leach (Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and Justice of the Peace)

body.p: Ohio County, Kentucky, farmer and Justice of the Peace. Kentucky native. Son of Mary Leach. Married to Mary V. Williams Leach in Ohio County, Kentucky, on February 28, 1850. Father of Mariah J. Leach, Anna A. Leach, Fielding W. Leach, Mary E. Leach, Monroe V. Leach, Alonzo B. Leach, and Susan C. Leach. Farmer in Ohio County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Ohio County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Ohio County in 1862. Justice of the Peace in Ohio County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, District 1, p. 22 A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Cromwell, p. 694.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Ohio County, Cromwell, p. 413 B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Ohio County Marriages, Film #001913021, p. 101.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Ohio County, KY, July 1863, p. 33.
